questions.text: What does doctype in HTML do?

answers.text: Tells the browser how to render the HTML markup
Loads all references to external JavaScript files
Adds CSS styles to the HTML page
It doesn't do anything it's just there as a comment to other developers

questions.explanation: The HTML doctype tells the browser how to render the HTML markup.

questions.text: What is *NOT* an HTML5 element?
questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: What is the difference between sessionStorage and localStorage?

answers.text: localStorage stores data with no expiration date
sessionStorage can only be used once
There's no difference they both accomplish the same thing

questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: How can you make a script run asynchronous?
questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: What is Flexbox?

answers.text: Is a layout mode providing for the arrangement of elements
A way to change the width of the browser window

questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: What does asynchronous mean?

answers.text: A script will send a request to the server, and continue its execution without waiting for the reply
One task waits for the next task to finish before running

questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: What is event bubbling?

answers.text: The handler of the parent works even if the child is clicked
Events that cause errors in the browser

questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: What is a problem with a single page app?
questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: How do JavaScript closures work?

answers.text: A function within another function, the inner function has access to variables in the outer function
It's a way to close a function in JavaScript
Closures help structure objects in JavaScript

questions.explanation: block is not a valid a HTML5 element

questions.text: Which of these is the superior framework?
